then add the following lines below. Hope it work's out for ya. Peace.

[V],Cyberpiraten,2012-08-24T16:25Z,"The Host file is simply to make shure the app does not connect their servers, you could maybe block the app in the firewall?
Anyhow, the Host Patch is working fine on all our's Macbook Pro's.
You could try this, almost the same just with a little twist.
Peace.
1. Paste the the following text below between 127.0.0.1 localhost and 255.255.255.255 broadcasthost :
# Block Adobe Activation
2.Save the document (Command+S)
3.Go to terminal and run the following from below to flush: sudo dscacheutil -flushcache

,Bynx,2012-08-28T23:31Z,Lavenza how about uploading your Host File?
,Lavenza,2012-08-29T04:05Z,"I'll try to write the steps that worked for ME as simple as I can :
1. Open Automator (It was already installed on my MAC since someone owned it before me, but I don't know if you have to download it?)
2. There will be a window asking to 'Choose a type for your document'...Click 'Open and existing document' and pick the Host Patch

3.You should see the script of the Host Patch written in purple in a box, from there the third line is # Block Adobe Activation, so copy the bunch of lines Cyberpiraten commented (including the # Block Adobe Activation) and replace the ones found in the script (SO from '# Block Adobe Activation' to '127.0.0.1
3. Save and close Automator
4. The Host Patch should now work, you can open it (it'll ask your user password) but really all it does is show you the script again so you don't need to do anything else with it.
5. Proceed the installation and instructions
I'm no programmer or genius in the matter so I hope this helps! It worked for me, can't 100% promise it will for everybody... Goodluck!"

,DemoDrift,2012-08-31T10:12Z,"Hey Guys...
For those who cannot open Hoste Patch.
MODIFYING HOST FILE:
You can easily modify Host file by yourself.
First, find the Host file on your MAC.
Finder>Go>Go to Folder (shift+cmmd+G)
Type ->  /etc/hosts
Is this the file that you needs to modify but the system doesn't let you do this.
Them, copy and paste and now you can modify.
I will put exactly how the file needs to be . Just select all and paste.
Save and just Drag and Drop inside the ""etc"" folder. Authenticate and Replace.
ps: make a copy of the original if you feel better."
,DemoDrift,2012-08-31T10:19Z,"Where is ****PASTE HERE**** you need to replace  with Cyberpiraten code. ( 15 comments above)
# Host Database
# localhost is used to configure the loopback interface
# when the system is booting.  Do not change this entry.
****PASTE HERE****
::1             localhost
,DemoDrift,2012-08-31T10:25Z,"Hey Guys...
For those who cannot open Hoste Patch.
MODIFYING HOST FILE:
You can easily modify Host file by yourself.
First, find the Host file on your MAC.
Finder>Go>Go to Folder (shift+cmmd+G)
Type ->  /etc/hosts
Is this the file that you needs to modify but the system doesn't let you do this.
Them, copy and paste in another place and now you can modify.
I will put how the file needs to be with a !!!PASTE HERE!!! where you need to replace with the code that Cyberpiraten give(15 comments above).
# Host Database
# localhost is used to configure the loopback interface
# when the system is booting.  Do not change this entry.
!!!PASTE HERE!!!
::1             localhost
Save and just Drag and Drop inside the ""etc"" folder. Authenticate and Replace.
ps: make a copy of the original if you feel better.    "

,aldo45,2012-09-05T16:57Z,"Works perfectly. Thanks Uploader. Before doing this make a BACKUP of your hosts file by opening Finder SHIFT+CMD+G then /private/etc/hosts. Copy the file to another location so you have a safety net.
THEN:
1) copy hosts posted on page 2 by uploader
2) Open Automator
3) Open Existing file>Hostes Patch
4) Delete whats in the purple part from #block Adobe TO 127.0.0.1 wwis-dubc1-vip60.adobe.com
5) Paste the stuff copied from here into the file
6) Save it
8) DISCONNECT FROM INTERNET COMPLETELY!!!
9) Run the .DMG
10) Click 'I have a serial""
11) Use one of the serials from the .rtf provided.
12) Install will finish then click CLOSE
13) Run the Hostes Patch file you edited earlier. You'll need to supply your admin password to grant it permission to run.
14) Next, go to Finder>Applications>Photoshop CS6 and right click on the app.
15) Show Package Contents>Frameworks
16) copy the folder ""Amtlib.framework"" which is included in the download.
17) Close everything
18) Reboot
19) Done.
For those having problems, restore the BACKUP Hosts file you made to /private/etc/hosts. Then make a fresh backup before you try again.
Make sure to paste the text between 127.0.0.1 localhost and 255.255.255.255 broadcasthost : - That's important.
If all else fails just download TEXTMATE and edit the host file with that. It's the same thing essentially."
